summary: A character reference letter written by Isabel Sylvia Maxwell, Ghislaine Maxwell's sister, to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application. The letter attests to Ghislaine's character, denies the allegations against her, explains her movements as being due to fear of the press and vigilantes, and offers Isabel as a 24/7 custodian if bail is granted.

persons.name: Isabel Sylvia Maxwell
persons.role: Author of letter, sister of Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The author and middle sister of Ghislaine Maxwell. She writes to support Ghislaine's character and bail application, offering to act as her 24/7 custodian.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail hearing. Her sister describes her as innocent, trustworthy, and a victim of media vilification and vigilante threats.

persons.name: Christine Malina-Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as Isabel's twin and is co-signing a bond for Ghislaine Maxwell's bail.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the letter is addressed.

persons.name: Robert Maxwell
persons.role: Father of Isabel and Ghislaine Maxwell (deceased)
persons.context: Mentioned indirectly as 'our father' who had public roles in politics and publishing, influencing the family's upbringing.

connections.description: Isabel is the older sister of Ghislaine, helped babysit her, and is writing a character reference and offering custodial support.
Christine is co-signing a bond for Ghislaine's bail, indicating a supportive familial relationship.

events.title: The Sun offers bounty for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The UK newspaper The Sun offered a Â£10,000 bounty for anyone who could get them 'in front of' Ghislaine Maxwell, which the author describes as incitement to violence.

events.title: Isabel Maxwell works as a supply teacher
events.description: Isabel Maxwell re-qualified to teach and worked as a supply teacher in Compton and Watts high schools for the 2017-2018 school year.

events.title: Isabel's son visits Ghislaine
events.description: Isabel's 10-year-old son visited Ghislaine Maxwell in New York on his own, as did other nieces and nephews.

keyFacts: Isabel Maxwell offers to act as a 24/7 custodian for Ghislaine Maxwell if she is released on bail, uprooting her life in California to stay with her in New York.

The letter claims Ghislaine Maxwell never left the United States and was not a fugitive, but was 'laying low' due to fear of press intrusion and vigilante threats, including a reported bounty from The Sun newspaper.
Isabel Maxwell and her twin sister Christine Malina-Maxwell are co-signing a bond worth $1,500,000, secured by a family home, to support Ghislaine's bail.
The author asserts Ghislaine Maxwell underwent many hours of deposition in civil litigation and did not take the Fifth, unlike Jeffrey Epstein, because she 'has nothing to hide.'
The letter describes a family upbringing emphasizing consideration for others and hospitality, modeling these as core to Ghislaine's character.
